comment.text:
Why doesn't this restaurant get more hype????? 10/10 meal, ambience, service just amazing! 

Found this restaurant while scrolling on Yelp located in the heart of midtown. We found rather cheap metered parking along the street but I'm not 100% sure if there's a parking lot. We came in right when they opened for dinner and opted to sit on the upper level (note: bottom level serves happy hour but it's not available on the top floor). Our waitress, Simone, was soooo attentive and knowledgeable in the menu. She helped us narrow down our appetizer options and we ended up getting the spanakopita. I was nervous because sometimes spanakopita can be a hit or miss but THIS was a hit. Served with a side salad which was so good as well.

For our entrees we got the lamb shank and the agora mixed grill.

Get the lamb shank it literally changed my life. So well seasoned with a HEARTY portion of lamb. Literally did not skimp out. It was $32 which I thought was a steal cause you know some places be charging an arm and a leg for lamb. The agora mixed grill is perfect if you're indecisive on what kebab to get.

Overall, absolutely obsessed with this restaurant and I'm so glad I tried it out. Definitely see myself frequenting this place and even trying their brunch.

This was my favorite restaurant while visiting Atlanta. My friend lives nearby and suggested it, so we walked (braved the cold and wind) 10 minutes to the restaurant.

We didn't have reservations, and there was no wait. Apparently, the restaurant was closed for remodeling and recently opened. You can dine downstairs near the bar, but most of the seating was upstairs. The stairway tiles in between were such a beautiful print reminiscent of Greek or Turkish design. There's intimate 2- person seating and larger seating for groups of 4 or more. The teal velvet seating added to the charm. The place was dimly lit and cozy. 

Mary Lyle was our waitress. She was amazing and attentive. My friend and I ordered cocktails and various appetizers to try. Excellent price points from $7-9 with large portions, not to mention, delicious.

I had the Gardenia cocktail with gin and cucumber that was refreshing. My friend ordered the Basilisk. I tried it, and it's green apple forward and also good.

The appetizers we chose were hummus, babaganoush, shakshuka, and spanakopita. Unfortunately, they ran out of the babaganoush past 8 pm. Mary Lyle brought us a complimentary appetizer - lentil kofte. It was served on a bed of romaine. 

Hummus: Large portion. I loved the fried chickpeas on top. It's served with a full basket of pita. 

Spanakopita:  4 pieces and comes with a side salad with vinaigrette dressing. The spinach and feta was baked to perfection.

Shakshuka: I absolutely loved this variation of shakshuka because it was eggplant based. It's typically tomato and egg. There was no egg, but it did have green peppers in a homemade tomato sauce. The eggplant and peppers were tender and paired nicely with the pita bread. Since the eggplant was cooked right, I'm sure the babaganoush was just as great.

I had eaten a large, Southern dish for lunch, so I was getting full. My friend ordered the Turkish moussaka that came with eggplant and ground beef and was served with rice. I had some of it, and it is a filling entree. Again, it was a large portion.

At the end of our meal, Mary Lyle surprised us with a free dessert - rice pudding. We killed it! There's a hint of cinnamon. It was creamy. I could taste the whipping cream or milk they used.

When I go back to Atlanta, I'm coming here for my Mediterranean fix. I just hope there's babaganoush next time! *fingers crossed*

photos.caption: Lentil kofte - free app given to us :)
The check in the wooden book and free wet wipes
Part of our Mediterranean spread pre Moussaka
Rice that comes with the moussaka

comment.text:
So some friends and I chose Agora as our dinner spot for Friendsgiving.  This spot has been closed down for a little while it has recently done a revamp in decor and the menu.  I will say parking can be a little tricky. There is apparently an old bank that you can Parkette. I didn't know that it was old because it still has signs up to says private property and it looks like a bank. But it is a spot that you can park at. There is also street parking. You do have to pay for parking unless it's between certain times in certain days. We went on a Sunday so parking was free on the street.

The inside is very beautiful. It's not a very big restaurant but it's a decent size. The food was very good. We got the meze platter which has so many different options to try and served with pita bread. We also ordered a couple other appetizers and shared. My favorite was the.sigara rolls. They were so cheesy and flaky from the dough.  All the food was super flavorful. And all the meat was super tender and juicy. We had a really great time celebrating our Friendsgiving here. Service was so good as well. I would definitely go back to this place.

photos.caption: Mix Beef and Lamb Gyro Platter

comment.text:
10/10 the cozy and welcoming environment right when you walk upstairs makes you sure you've found the perfect place to eat. Our server was amazing... Since it was our first time dining in not sure if they do half off bottles of wine every Monday or just then, but i will say i had the Argentinian Malbec (Manos Negras) and it was DELICIOUS. Sometimes half bottle wines suck, but that was NOT the case here. I highly recommend the hummus and the lamb plate! Highly recommend!!!! 
P.S. there is no parking lot
Food is great!! Drinks are divine and customer service is impeccable. My now go-to Mediterranean restaurant. Hidden gem !
Good food. Excellent service. Nice atmosphere. Everyone was satisfied with their orders and it was enough for next day lunch.

We were in town for the Americasmart and picked this spot for dinner. We were pleasantly surprised to find a place that we could sit and have dinner and it was less than a 10 minute drive. The atmosphere is beautiful, the service was fantastic, and the food and drinks did not disappoint!   We had lentil soup, apps, salmon, baklava, and their specialty gin cocktails. Can't wait to go back!!!

The atmosphere here is top notch. The restaurant extends across two floors, downstairs being the bar from which they have happy hour F-S 30% off apps. Upstairs you'll find the formal dining room and kitchen. We were greeted so warmly and started our meal with a complimentary lentil based kofta lettuce wrap. It was surprisingly delicious and had lots of flavor. This tickled our palettes for the rest of the meal. I ordered the mix grill plate and my bf had the lamb gyro. The mixed grill plate is really the go-to pick as it has a lamb chop, kofta, beef and chicken kabobs. The pita tasted so fresh as did the yogurt sauce which was great for dipping the meats into. Everything was tender, juicy and had that nice grill flavor to it. Even the chicken which can be dried out by the grill sometimes. I also really enjoyed the charred octopus on top of some kind of lentil/bean puree. It was seasoned so well and had some trout roe on top of it that added a phenomenal burst of flavor.
This our 2nd time here in the past week. We through enjoyed our meal and the service the first time. The second time the taste of the food was even better. Very helpful and friendly staff.

My mom and I just went here for dinner tonight and it was soooo delicious! This is some of the best authentic Mediterranean and Turkish food everrrr. We got the meze platter for an appetizer (I didn't love the babaganoush). For mains my mom got the chicken kebabs and I got the vegetable kebabs with falafel. This food had so much flavor!!! So bomb. Also the staff were all very friendly and the vibes were immaculate. This restaurant is a slayyyyyyyy

It's good for a quick and healthy meal, but not great *for takeout.* I think that a dine-in experience would've improved the food quality a lot!

I picked up my meal just 10 mins after ordering from Cafe Agora. I walked, but for those driving, know that there is it a ton of parking in this area because of construction on the plaza in front of the restaurant. When it's done, it will be beautiful! Service was quick and easy. The order was correct.

I ordered a Greek salad and added lamb and tzatziki. The portion was huge (leftovers for lunch tomorrow!), the meat was really delicious, and the veggies were fresh. Could've used more cucumber though! I thought the tzatziki was a bit too thick and had a very mild flavor compared to what I'm used to. The tabouli wasn't great...it was 95% parsley with a few tomatoes and onions -- like tiiiiny pinches -- and barely dressed. I wouldn't order it again. I also got spanakopita (not pictured) and wasn't impressed. Great flavor but the puff pastry had no crispiness / was almost soggy which I suspect was (at least in part) due to getting it to go. 

Overall, I would come back -- it's open late compared to other healthy dinners in the area (10pm) and it was pretty inexpensive! I'll probably stick to salads and meat platters though.

Another amazing restaurant in Atlanta. We didn't have a reservation but was shown to a 2-top. Our server was genuine and warm, making recommendations. We shared a sampler appetizer and the lamb and rice entree. Some of the best lamb either of us have encountered. All of the various samples were fresh and perfectly seasoned. I will definitely be back.
The food and service were top notch. Must visit for good authentic Mediterranean food with a chill/chic ambience.

I've been a faithful customer of Agora for 4 years now and while the recent renovations and price gouge are a result of much deserved growth, most of the loyalty from longtime customers may be lost due to the restaurant feeling more like a cash grab by the new owners.

I can see most of the new clientele being those that want to check it out one time to give it a try, but may not return again. Also lost a lot of fan favorites from the menu - gyros and falafel platters are no more. :(

The food has lost it's love, but I appreciate how pretty the decor is now. After 4 years I probably won't be returning even though they had the best dolmas I ever tasted. A sad loss for what used to be a restaurant that made you feel like family.

They recently redecorated the midtown location after almost a year of being closed. Additionally they also rebranded with a nice menu and a lovely interior. 

With that being said, I expected the prices to go up, but not by this much. They need to be revised to a $$$ restaurant. 
Regardless of how good the food is, I think it lost the cozy feel and the appeal that it used to have. The portion sizes have decreased in size and the menu options have been decimated. Gone are the days where you can swing by for a small plate and escape under $15.  This restaurant will struggle to keep up with establishments like Olive Bistro and Rumi's Kitchen a few blocks away.

We used to get take out gyros nearly every single Friday from Cafe Agora. It closed for renovations and we waited and waited for it to re-open. It finally did!The interior is beautiful and they have changed their concept some from the local order at the counter, quick service menu. We wanted to eat outdoors and we were offered the to-go menu. No big deal. BUT no gyro for dinner?? Only available at lunch. Sad. Maybe in time they will bring it back their amazing sandwich at dinner for all the loyal Midtowners who are at Agora for years.

Agora has grown! It's nearly doubled in size and is packed full of neighbors enjoying fabulous food and excellent- knowledgeable service. 

It's still quaint small charming gem. The bar area is super nice and free of tv. So, people are talking, eating, enjoying company. It's wonderful environment. 

Spirits are fantastic! Nice specialty list of cocktails made right in front of you. Passion fruit / chili/ tequila concoction was perfectly balanced and yummy. Old fashion made perfectly. 

Calamari is really really really good. But if you are sharing ask for extra sauce. It's hard to share. 

We had kabobs... lamb and a chicken. They were full meals with little side salad, rice, & pita. I still think the lamb serving size was much larger but either way- you are going to be satisfied.

Dessert... if only we would've not scarfed down two courses- maybe I could tell you about dessert. Lol. There's always a goal for next visit. 

So, tell DoorDash - not tonight... and go visit Agora. Enjoy actually participating in real experience. Enjoy! 

* in addition, they do have an upstairs dining room if you aren't comfortable eating at the bar or need more family environment.

Ordered the lamb gyro platter for dinner pickup around 630pm on Saturday. It was ready within 10 minutes so really quick service!

The lamb gyro was pretty nice and tender, very delicious. It comes on a nice bed of rice and sauce with a piece of pita. They also give a nice salad (dressing already added) which was great. A good amount of food (and meat) for $15. 

Definitely recommend!

Pretty good Mediterranean spot in midtown. Interior says "take out spot" to me, but there are a few seats. We had the mixed meze platter and of note were the yogurt haydari (which was brand new to me) and the carrot salad! We also had a falafel platter which came with a deliciously dressed Greek salad but we were saddened by the salad portion. Huge heaping portion of hummus. Pita was fluffy and delicious. Falafel was crisp and well seasoned. Definitely a solid spot!

Is it wrong to actually *love* a restaurant? Because I love Cafe Agora so much I kinda want to buy it a ring and move in. 

Cafe Agora is hands-down serving up some of the best Mediterranean food in Atlanta -- so much so, it's quickly become my favorite place to order delivery from. Every single thing I've ever ordered from there was made with care, love and attention and portion sizes are generous. Favorites include the carrot salad (I know, but trust me on this), homemade dolmas and baba ganoush that's perfectly creamy and heavily jacked with garlic. If you're planning on having a date after eating here, they'd better like garlic. In fact, that's a good standard to live by -- if they don't like garlic, they're not worth dating.  

As if this wasn't enough, they're also really lovely people. I remember once I put in the notes how much I loved their carrot salad and they sent along a little extra portion, just for me. 

I'm not lucky enough to have a Mediterranean mom, but if I was... I'm pretty sure her food would taste like Cafe Agora's.

I love this mom and pop shop! The space inside is limited and grungy, but the food is authentic. This time, I ordered the Lamb Gyro Platter, Lamb Gyro Wrap, and the Mix Meze Plate. The Lamb Gyro Platter came with Tzatziki, a cucumber and yogurt sauce that made the dish taste even better. I enjoyed the platter much more than the Lamb Gyro Wrap, which was too dry. Also, I highly recommend the Mix Meze Plate, which came with a range of side dishes including Hummus, Tabouli, Piyaz, Eggplant Salad, and Baba Ghanoush. There wasn't a single item in the Mix Meze Plate that I didn't enjoy.

photos.caption: The Lamb Gyro Platter, Lamb Gyro Wrap, and the Mix Meze Plate

comment.text:
This is one of the few high quality and affordable spots in Midtown, and a great spot for either eating outside and enjoying the sunshine or grabbing takeout to gorge on at home. 
I came for lunch on a beautiful day and both me and my lunch buddy had our food in about ten minutes. We sat outside and he enjoyed his falafel wrap and I my adana kebab plate. The wraps are probably the perfect amount for a lunch, and convenient, too! He really liked the falafel here. The plates are HEFTY and despite me being hungry and coming off of a bike ride I still couldn't finish my entire dish--there is so much meat and SO much rice. The salad was a bit underdressed but that is a minor issue. The kebab was well seasoned and juicy. 
I also like that they are situated on a side street in midtown so it's a bit quieter and you can really enjoy your meal if you sit just outside.
LOVE this Mediterranean food experience. Get the sampler appetizer to try tastes if all the goodness. Very reasonably priced for lunch.

Cafe Agora is a solid option for Turkish/Mediterranean fare at a good value. We recently ordered takeout from this humble Midtown storefront, and were not disappointed. While she went with this simple Greek salad and a side of hummus with pita, I ordered the mezze plate, a selection of heaping portions of various dips, spreads, and salads that made for a nice dinner and lunch the next day. Whereas I usually lean more Middle Eastern, I was delighted to try some of the Turkish dishes that were new to me, like the piyaz red bean bean salad and the ezme tomato relish. Of particular note was the haydari, a yogurt seasoned with garlic, dill and walnuts- creamy yet bright, it really livened up the plate. Cafe Agora is a great spot, and on my list for Mediterranean takeout when I am looking for something beyond just hummus and pita.

Sooo...my first time having food from Cafe Agora Midtown. 

I was excited......

My thrill was quickly diminished by the time I placed my first fork of salad in my mouth and then Iooked into my container and there was an unsuspecting guest.  Obviously I spit out what was in my mouth. 

I'm now worried if anything extra ....pests that is.. was in the gyro. 

Now I have to give a bad and take unnecessary steps to get this resolved.

photos.caption: Bug in salad.  Definitely not a black  pepper or any other seasoning. 4/5/2019

comment.text:
Love their gyros and a few weeks ago I was ready to venture into about one (privately owned!) place a week. There were three staff including the gentleman at the front case.

Upstairs, seating is not allowed but you can use the restroom. The menu is full as before, and my lamb gyro was ready quickly. There are only three or four tables outside and felt well spaced.

Definitely feel comfortable going back when I'm finished getting my hair done across the street.

photos.caption: The first visit for my love! Gyro time
Gyro foreground, everything else fades in back...

comment.text:
Food was tasty, but service was kind of off and my take out order was slightly messed up. Due to construction on the street there is really no seating for this spot, so we got takeout. 

I have family that lives across the street from this place and she was craving Mediterranean so we tried this spot. 

I ordered the mezze plate - I wanted the small but was charged for the large and was not given pita even when I asked if pita was included (cuz I was gonna order some just in case it wasn't). I was told that 2 pita was included for the mezze plate but they totally forgot when I opened my takeout package at home. My sister ordered the gyro plate and was given one pita. The mezze platter was tasty, I will give them that but not having a pita to dip in is kind of not fun. The food came out super fast, but maybe so fast that they messed up the order? How do you forget to give pita at a Mediterranean place, especially if it's a mezze plate? My sister did enjoy her gyro platter. 

Maybe I caught them on a bad day, but I wouldn't race to get food from here. It was tasty but kind of overpriced for the crappy service.

Ordered pick up from this location. Everything was well packed and still warm by the time we got home. Our favorite is their iskender kabab, which is a Turkish dish. We often get the iskender and the mixed grill platter and we share.

photos.caption: Iskender kabab platter. It's all about the tomato/red sauce. Don't let it sit long or the pita will get too soggy.
Salad from the mixed platter. They gave us a whole box
Mixed grill platter without salad and replated at home.

comment.text: Never willl order from here again. Drove all the way here to avoid delivery fees. And it's literally the soggiest fries and the most bland food ever. I'm on my way to Whole Foods for peppers and seasoning now. So sad.

photos.caption: $17 worth of food. ... I don't think so. I spent $33 on total.

comment.text:
Cafe Agora is one of those types of local places I like to hit up frequently for quick healthy and tasty bite to eat.  A nice quaint little place just off Peachtree with authentic flavors.

While the offerings don't quite bring the biggest pizazz, they pack solid flavors, into a healthy serving size at very reasonable prices.  Overall I find myself here every couple of weeks picking up the vegetarian Falafel platter!

The staff is genuine, kind and always quick with a smile. 

Overall, you're not going to find forty flavors of hummus, twelve different pita types or food doused in salty spices, instead you'll get a good wholesome meal from a wonderful local restaurant.

Lamb / Beef gyro, regular size (not large). Quite good. Soft, moist pita, plenty of meat and fresh, crisp lettuce and onion. No tomato and it was missed but was not listed on the ingredients. Tzatziki was flavorful. The best? No, but really good.  Would definitely order again.

The Spanakopita...a doughy, almost flavorless disappointment. Good size, but couldn't eat more than a bite or two. How does phyllo get that doughy and undercooked....other than being undercooked. A shame, I was looking forward to it as it's my favorite at other Greek restaurants. Skip this one. 

Baklava...very good. Thought I was done with that review? Nope. $5.35 for (2 pieces) that totaled in size of 1 1/2" x 2 1/2". Trust me, I measured. Now...the issue at hand. How was the Baklava crispy, crunchy phyllo and the Spanakopita was as wet as a lasagna noodle? 

Greek salad, minimal feta, even more minimal dressing. Tomatoes that had a bit of a snap as they weren't ripe. As we are all living with produce availability I will not judge the tomato issue harshly. There needs to be more feta and dressing on the side...when the order requested dressing on the side. 

And I ate all of this in a hotel room, with no utensils even though I requested them. 

Happy to give great reviews, hate giving less that stellar reviews. This place is close,  close to being good. They just aren't there yet. 

You have other options for Greek food. Steer clear of this one for now.

photos.caption: Baklava...really? This small? Delicious, but not worth $5.35.

comment.text:
Cafe agora is delicious! You really cant go wrong with eating here! They are perfect if you are craving a meal. I have really enjoyed everything I have ordered from here 

The chicken is to die for!

Located near Midtown MARTA station, this little Turkish/Mediterranean place will really surprise you! The place, from outside looks like a small restaurant. Even when you enter, it feels like a very small place with a few tables down stairs and a big seating area upstairs. You order at the counter with the menu displayed behind it, with pictures representing what you would expect.
But my god the food is amazing! I always get the chicken shish kabab entree- char grilled, succulent marinated chicken pieces served on rice with balsamic glazed lettuce/cucumber salad, 4 pcs pita and tziziki sauce ($13.5). We also tried the spanakopita which is essentially like a lasagna ($6). Service was quick, and they bring the food to your table. Would recommend again for a quick bite to eat!
Best Mediterranean spot this side of the Mississippi! Cafe agora is a great local spot that is a midtown staple. The platter and gyros are amazing. Definitely recommend!

The stairs are out of the question now so I have to settle for takeout.  I used Uber Eats, delivery was on time and everything was warm and fresh.  The pita was so hot but wrapped in foil that I wasn't sure what it was.
I had the Mixed Grill with Rice and a small Greek salad and the Maza Platter.  My favorite thing over other Mediterranean restaurants in ATL the salad with your meal.  Always fresh. 
It's a shame they don't have a downstairs dining area.

photos.caption: Maza Platter @ Cafe Agora Midtown ATL
Greek Salad with enteee @ Cafe Agora Midtown ATL
Mixed Grill @ Cafe Agora Midtown ATL

comment.text:
I will give 2 stars because the food is pretty good. I used to come here all the time (there are better mediterranean restaurants in Atlanta).  I used to be served good food on a plate. I came here yesterday and dined in,  with a friend, and was served on a cheap styrofoam package (which is not healthy by the way). The chicken pieces were not cut properly. There are was no harissa offered. I was told that there was hot sauce, but didn't get any. And the salad, which came with my chicken barely had dressing on it.

I will never be back.

You will absolutely not walk out hungry. The midtown location is my FIRST choice when I want Mediterranean. 

All of the gyros are filled generously, you can't go wrong w any of the meat options - not exaggerating, all that matters is how heavy of a meal you want. 

Please please try the DOLMAS they are bursting with flavor. And they give a hefty serving of tzatziki alongside the dolmades and on top of the gyros. 

My one personal advice is ask for light lettuce on the gyros; it's crunchy and refreshing but I find too much can be messy and some bites too lettucy, ha. 

They have a $10.99 lunch special including: a gyro, Greek fries (to die for) and a drink. From 11-1 pm. 

Top off with the RICE PUDDING. Wow, it's the creamiest and most comforting way to finish a big meal like that.

photos.caption: Mixed Lamb and Beef Gyro, Dolma, fries
Ask for light lettuce for less lettuce than this ^ I'm a regular here and they're generous w lettuce on the gyros
Look at that Tzatziki to dolma ratio

comment.text:
We went to Cafe Agora last night for take out.  I knew we had eaten there 2 yrs ago but we kind of forgot about it.  It was really good, so good my husband and I both individually had an urge to go back tonight.  And we did!  I had the lamb shish kabab both nights and tonight added the eggplant salad (I think).  It was sooo delish!  My husband got the lamb gyro and he loved it and had it both nights.  Who does THAT?!!  It was even better tonight because of the eggplant really pulled it all together.   I asked my husband if he mentioned to the counter guy that we had come a second night in a row and he said no.  I said, that's okay we can tell him tomorrow night.  LOL It is a casual place but fast and really fresh!
Enjoy!

First time at this lovely establishment. Came early on a Sunday morning, before valet parking started, so parking wasn't an issue. However, I can see how easily parking can be a hassle. The service was fast & friendly. 

* For starters we had the small Maza Platter with bread and Sigara Boregi (Cheese). The Maza Platter was delicious and the small serving was more than enough food. The Cheese Boregi was delicious!! A nicely seasoned sharp cheese fried in a crispy outer shell. Absolutely yummy. 

* The regular Lamb Gyro with a side Greek salad was huge. The lamb was delicious. Pretty much your standard gyro filled with lettuce & onions. 

* Also, the complementary rice pudding as the end was delicious!

This place is all about the owner! He is a charmer. Friendly and caring,  everyone is his brother or friend! People are clearly drawn to him. Who wouldn't be?  He makes you feel like you belong!

The food is excellent. The quality is great and the quantity is generous. We shared a plate and were so glad we did!  The Baba Ganoush is lovely, the pita is fresh and the chicken had an excellent sauce that gave it a pizzaz. Cafe Agora does a hopping business. There's not much space inside but there are tables outside. I saw a lot of take away orders. 

Looking for a relaxed atmosphere where you get great food at a reasonable price, where you feel like you're a long lost friend and where you will leave full and satisfied? Find your way to Cafe Agora!

photos.caption: 1/2 of a chicken plate because we split it.

comment.text: I don't even really like Mediterranean food so I had low expectations but got the chicken salad to-go and was amazed! The chicken was so tender and juicy unlike the normal chicken I see in salads, the dressing was wonderful, and the pita was so soft and pillowy! And all for $12, not bad at all (they gave a decent amount of chicken). I will definitely get this again, especially for a healthier but delicious lunch.

Sorry but the food was over cooked and oily. Only tasted like grease. I had the lamb gyro and the chicken pita sandwich. Chicken was definitely better than the gyro just because my gyro was over done and greasy. Also there wasn't any feta or veggies on the sandwiches, just chopped lettuce. 

Service was good, place was hard to get to due to construction outside. Personally I probably won't be back.

Having lived in Chicago, Cleveland, Seattle, San Francisco, and Atlanta, I can objectively say that this is the best gyro I've ever had. I always come back here when visiting Atlanta. 

The portion size is huge, the meat is high quality and tasty, and the price is cheap. I highly recommend the large gyro sandwich. You won't regret it.

We came Cafe Agora for a Saturday lunch. Located off busy Peachtree Street, it is a basic shop where you order your food, pay and they will bring your food when done. 

The menu is on the wall above the counter and I ordered a Falafel Pita Wrap and my partner ordered a Chicken Pita sandwich, both came with seasoned french fries. We had water to drink, and you help yourself. 

It was a warm spring afternoon and we sat outside. After about 5 minutes the food was brought out to us. 

The Falafel Pita Wrap was served wrapped in foil. It was stuffed full and was a little difficult to eat without a fork. The sandwich was served in a warm pita spongy bread, three or four falafel balls, lettuce, hummus, and a creamy yogurt sauce. The fries were seasoned and twice fried. Both were delicious. My partner's  Chicken Pita he said it was nicely done. 

To sum it up, the restaurant is nothing special inside, more of a counter than a restaurant. Not much service, but what there was, was fine. The food was above average. Outside dining was lovely. We will return.

The food is great here. The mixed grill is my favorite! The greek salad and ground lamb is amazing. I also enjoy the gyros as well. The guy that works there will call you his friend:) he's such a wonderful guy. Best restaurant in that area hands down.

I eat here at least 3-4 times a week. I get the Greek salad with lamb every single time.

My boy B might be the nicest restaurant owner in Midtown. On many occasions he hooks me up with a free rice pudding.

The food is delicious and healthy. The people are kind and inviting. 

What more can you ask for?

That's my word and I'm sticking to it.

My parents were in town and wanted some Mediterranean food. I have taken them to Aviva by Kameel and they love it. But it was night time so that was not an option. Cafe Agora got good reviews and was nearby, so great option. We opted to park on Juniper and then walk over. Ended up being a nice walk. And I showed my folks the Margaret Mitchell house. 

We ordered a few dishes 
(1)Lamb Shish Kebab
Chargrilled, marinated lamb pieces. Served with rice, marinated pita bread, salad and tzatziki sauce.
(2)Lamb & Beef Gyro Platter
Thinly sliced, spit roasted lamb and beef gyro. Served with rice, marinated pita bread, salad and tzatziki sauce.
(3) Agora Mixed Grill
Our signature plate. Pieces of lamb shish, chicken shish, kofte, and lamb and beef gyro meat. Served with rice, marinated pita bread, salad and tzatziki sauce.
(4) Falafel 

The Agora Mixed Grill was mine. I really only liked the shish. The rest of it was a waste for me. Luckily, my parents ate some of the rest of it. They really liked the lamb. Gyro was OK. Falafel was good. Ordered some baklava. My dad really liked it, but I did NOT. We stopped by after and got some baklava from Bezoria for me and my mom.

Service was friendly though a tad on the slower side.

Cafe Agora -- decent food at affordable prices and friendly service.
*****
I. LOCATION & PARKING: Using Google Maps or Waze, one shouldn't have any trouble finding this restaurant. It sits in between Savi Provisions and a Delta Credit Union location.

Regarding parking, I suggest finding a spot on Peachtree Place NE. Download the Parkmobile app before getting there. 

II. FOOD & DRINK: Like many other Mediterranean joints, Cafe Agora offers rice plates, sandwiches, salads, and desserts, and various vegetable appetizers. The food, honestly, does not set itself apart from others, but I do think they can satisfy a fix. What I've had:

*Fried Eggplant: Like the name says, this appetizer comes with fried eggplant as well as green peppers, tomato sauce, and garlic. It's basically a Mediterranean stirfry with a lot of flavors. I wouldn't necessarily recommend it, but if you love eggplant then give it a try for yourself.

*Lamb & Beef Gyro: Call me basic, but I love this beef and lamb beauty wrapped in a pita bread. Topped with lettuce, onions and tzatziki sauce, it perfectly combines savory, crunchy, and fresh. The sauce could use more garlic, dill, and black pepper to bring a harder kick, but it did a well-enough job tying everything together. Consider ordering this!

*Hummus: Their hummus -- consisting of mashed chickpeas, fresh lemon juice, mined garlic, olive oil, and tahini and garnished with ezme and tabouli -- is A-OK. I thought it could have been smoother and more flavorful. After having a few other hummuses in the city, though, I wouldn't call it one of my favorites. 

III. SERVICE: During each of my visits, I've been called, "friend" and received my food promptly. I've never had any problems.

IV. AMBIENCE & DECOR: In contrast to the rest of the Peachtree Street NE, this hole-in-the-wall seems to have endured the renovations in the area. (That's a good thing.) The humble interior has two floors, and, by the looks of the seating, the restaurant caters to the lunch crowd.

V. PRICES: It's hard to complain about prices when most things on the menu cost less than $15. And when considering Cafe Agora resides in Midtown, it's a great bargain.

VI. OVERALL: I wouldn't consider Cafe Agora as one of my favorite Mediterranean restaurants in Atlanta, but when it comes to affordability, speed, and quality this place is hard to beat.

My go-to place to order from. The food is always fresh and quality/taste is consistent. Great service as well. I usually go for the Meze plate so I can get a little of everything (my favorite part is the babaganoush). Definitely recommend!!

I just catered a dinner for 16 with Cafe Agora. Everything went perfectly.  Great food, very plentiful and varied, everyone loved it. Service was smooth and professional. I'll definitely use them again.
